author: Mukut Das
title: Locals throng city pandals as rain gloom clears away
text: Guwahati: Though a spell of moderate rain lashed the city on Saptami, the sky later cleared up, allowing city dwellers to celebrate the festival and visit the various innovative theme-based pandals in the city.Most pandals witnessed high footfall on Thursday evening.Over 400 puja pandals have been erected across the city this year, putting efforts to attract pandal hoppers through spectacular art and lighting.While the West Kamakhya Colony Sarbajanin Durga Puja pandal, where the stunning 60-foot-tall pandal has been designed using traditional Assamese motifs and craftsmanship, offered artistic excellence, the Subash Nagar Sarbajanin Durga Puja in the Pandu area attracted visitors with its theme depicting the lifestyle of the fishermen from the banks of the Ganges.Similarly, the cutting-edge AI technology used to narrate stories from the Mahabharata at the Athgaon Sarvajanik Durga Puja pandal attracted a huge crowd of revellers.We also published the following articles recentlyCommittee to evaluate Durga Puja pandalsThe Bengali Welfare Association in Prayagraj has formed a 14-member committee for evaluating Durga Puja idols and pandals, prioritizing facial expressions and grandeur. They emphasized proper management, including volunteer deployment, drinking water, CCTV, and fire safety systems. The committee includes experts like Kaveri Vij, Shefali Gupta, and Archana Pandey.113969953A comprehensive guide for pandal hoppers this Durga PujaBengaluru's neighbourhoods are bustling with Durga Puja festivities. Highlights include tribal Dhokra art at HSR Layout, a regal Laal Sonar Mahal theme at Nagapura, and Pingla art focusing on women's power at Ulsoor. Other themes include vintage Bengali culture at Jayamahal, Kannada-Bengali fusion at Koramangala, Kashi Vishwanath decor at Hebbal, and tribal arts at Bellandur.114057283Pandal-hoppers ring in puja seasonOn the first day of Durga Puja, people in Lucknow, especially from the Bengali community, visited pandals in traditional attire to offer prayers. Celebrations included dancing to dhak beats, clicking selfies, and enjoying delicacies. The festival served as a reunion for friends and families, drawing individuals from different cities to immerse in the festivities.114097004

author: MENAFN
title: Italy To Send SAMP/T Air Defense System To Ukraine Media | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - UkrinForm) Italy is planning to announce a new military aid package for Ukraine - which will include a SAMP/T air defense system.
That's according to Sky News , which cites Italian media, Ukrinform reports.
Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni will officially make the announcement at the G7 Summit being held in Puglia, Italy, next month, news website La Repubblica reported.
Stinger anti-aircraft missile systems and long-range Storm Shadow missiles are also thought to be included in the package.
It will be the ninth military aid package sent to Ukraine from Italy.
This month Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba and Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani discussed the steps that Italy can take to find and deliver air defense systems to Ukraine.
MENAFN03052024000193011044ID1108170384

author: @nbcwashington
title: Hamas says it accepts cease-fire proposal from Egyptian, Qatari mediators
text:
Hamas said it told Egyptian and Qatari negotiators that it has approved a cease-fire proposal to halt the war in Gaza, according to a press statement. Israel did not confirm whether it would accept or reject the deal that Hamas approved. Negotiations, which have been ongoing for months, intensified over the weekend, with facilitation from U.S. CIA Director William Burns, alongside mediators from Egypt and Qatar. Hamas said it told Egyptian and Qatari negotiators that it has approved a cease-fire proposal to halt the war in Gaza, according to a press statement.
Israel did not confirm whether it would accept or reject the deal that Hamas approved.
“We are exploring every single thing that we hear and we are exhausting the potential about negotiations and bringing back the hostages and that is our main mission to bring them home as quickly as possible,” Israel Defense Forces Officer Daniel Hagari said at a press briefing following Hamas’ announcement. “But in parallel, we are continuing to act in an operational manner, in the Gaza Strip and we will continue to do so.”
Negotiations intensified over the weekend, with facilitation from U.S. CIA Director William Burns, alongside mediators from Egypt and Qatar.
The negotiations came amid Israel’s ongoing threats to invade Gaza’s southernmost city of Rafah, which appeared imminent if a temporary cease-fire agreement was not reached.
U.S. officials have repeatedly warned Israel against an offensive in Rafah, where millions of civilians have taken refuge.
President Joe Biden reiterated that stance on a Monday call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
Last week, the U.S. paused a shipment of weapons to Israel, including 2,000-pound bombs, as Israel continued to signal that a ground invasion of Rafah could be coming soon, two senior administration officials confirmed to NBC News.
On Monday, Israel ordered civilians in eastern Rafah to evacuate, adding to fears that Israel plans to invade the southern city.
Ali Jadallah | Anadolu | Getty Images Hundreds of Palestinians, including children, migrate from eastern neighborhoods after Israel warns them with pamphlets to evacuate Rafah, Gaza on May 06, 2024. NBC News previously reported that the deal would require Hamas to release 33 hostages in exchange for Israel agreeing to release Palestinian prisoners and pause military operations, which would ease the flow of humanitarian aid into Gaza.
This is developing news. Check back for updates.
